-[interviewer] Thirty-eight million? -Yeah.

a good enough sound system

translation.en: The girls were like, "Holy hell, what is that? What do you do?"

translation.en: [Martin] We gained traction.
We start growing across the 1,500-member mark.

translation.en: [Billy] Looking back to when I moved to New York, I was looking for a community.

translation.en: I wanted perks and guidance and, really,

translation.en: and Billy is an amazing entrepreneur.
This is a young kid who figured out how to get these millennials

and the big thing they had was this clubhouse in West Village.
translation.ko: 웨스트 빌리지에 있는 클럽하우스가 참 좋았어요

translation.en: You could take dates and friends there and that's where they had the events.
translation.ko: 데이트 장소로 이용하거나 친구들을 데려갈 수 있었어요 이벤트를 열던 장소였어요

translation.en: I helped Billy design wine tasting series and lecture series
and many different things that brought these kids together
translation.ko: 젊은이들을 모을 수 있는 커뮤니티 느낌이 나는

translation.en: with a sense of community.
The parties were unbelievable. They had live music, booze and food...
translation.ko: 정말 대단한 파티였죠 라이브 음악, 술과 음식...

translation.en: I saw Ja Rule a bunch.
Ja Rule is taking his talents to a new business.
translation.ko: 자 룰이 유능한 친구들과 새로운 사업을 시작합니다

translation.en: The rapper lending his creative mind to an elite credit card for millenials.
translation.ko: 자 룰은 밀레니얼 세대를 위한 신용 카드 사업에 참여 중인데요

translation.en: What we're doing with Magnises is growing very fast.
translation.ko: 매그니시스 사업이 아주 빠르게 성장 중이에요

translation.en: [Martin] We built on an app, went digital. We crossed the 10,000-member mark.
translation.ko: 앱을 만들어 모바일로 이동했는데 회원 수가 만 명을 넘었어요

translation.en: We were taking in close to $2 million in membership fees.
translation.ko: 연회비 수입으로 2백만 불 가깝게 벌어들이고 있었어요

translation.en: As we kept moving with Magnises,
he wanted to penetrate the New York upper class.
He thought that the Maserati and flying to meetings in private jets
translation.ko: 마세라티와 전용 비행기를 타고 회의에 참석해야

translation.en: were necessary in his pursuit of changing his external image
translation.ko: 자신의 이미지를 바꿀 수 있다고 생각했죠

translation.en: and he thought that image would also be a serious driver for the company.
translation.ko: 이미지가 회사를 이끄는 중요한 원동력이라고 믿었어요

translation.en: [Andy] I hosted probably 40 events for Magnises
and a lot of the members enjoyed being a part of that community.
translation.ko: 많은 회원들이 커뮤니티에 소속되는 걸 좋아했죠

translation.en: That audience, I think, was the audience that Billy was focused on
translation.ko: 파이어에서 집중한 타깃 대상이 매그니시스 타깃 대상과 동일했어요

translation.en: as far as Fyre was concerned as well...
but it was a vision that was so big...
translation.ko: 비전이 너무 커서 "나만의 오두막집을 예약하세요 파이어 비치 클럽, 한정 수량"

translation.en: that it was not something that was going to be easy to pull off.
translation.ko: 쉽게 실현할 수 있는 일이 아니었어요

translation.en: Could you imagine trying to host a music festival,
translation.ko: 심지어 마이애미비치나 보스톤, LA 같은 데에서

translation.en: even on Miami Beach or in Boston or LA?
Almost impossible without an incredibly big infrastructure.
translation.ko: 큰 인프라가 갖춰지지 않으면 거의 불가능한 일이에요

translation.en: So, dial it up to a small island in the Bahamas.
It would probably be the most difficult place you could do it.
translation.ko: 성공적으로 실현하기 가장 벅찬 장소일 거예요

translation.en: Billy called me and he said, "Listen,
I need your help and I need you to get to the Bahamas as soon as possible."
translation.ko: 도움이 필요하니 최대한 빨리 바하마로 와달라고 부탁했어요

translation.en: And I flew in, not in any role, except sort of subtly
translation.ko: 그래서 갔죠 특정한 역할을 맡지 않은 채

translation.en: being the new leader and being kind of...
Billy's whisperer.
To do a proper music festival,
I would say you should try to start the...
the design and the fundraising, everything at least 12 months out.
translation.ko: 설계, 자금 마련 등 준비 작업을 시작해야 해요

translation.en: The true core team that came in literally had
six to eight weeks to build this thing and put it together.
[interviewer] Were you ever aware that they said they had bought an island?
It's like you couldn't...
differentiate what was true
and what wasn't true.
I think we chose the right island.
translation.ko: 우리에게 맞는 섬을 선택한 것 같아요

translation.en: We got ours for ten million.
Freehold land, no lease. We own the land forever.
translation.ko: 자유보유권 땅이라 계약도 없고 평생 소유할 수 있어요

translation.en: I think it was like, he had to put a million down
and then pay the rest by a certain amount of time.
translation.ko: 일정 기간까지 잔금을 내게 되어 있었을걸요

translation.en: I don't know if that million was ever paid.
translation.ko: 그 백만 달러 계약금도 정말 냈는지 모르겠어요

translation.en: This was Pablo Escobar's island twenty-five years ago.
translation.ko: 이 섬은 25년 전에 파블로 에스코바르의 섬이었어요

translation.en: So we're taking the dream for your average person in America
translation.ko: 미국의 보통 사람들을 위한 꿈을 실현해주는 거예요

translation.en: or wherever they are and saying, "For three days,
you can become Pablo Escobar."
translation.ko: 3일 동안은 파블로 에스코바르가 될 수 있어요

translation.en: [Andy] Billy was dealing with Pablo Escobar's lawyer,
he was dealing with family members.
[J.R.] Norman's Cay is rich in history
translation.ko: 노먼스 케이는 코카인 거물들이 바하마를 통해 마약을 운반했던

translation.en: with cocaine drug lords running their drugs through the Bahamas.
translation.ko: 노먼스 케이는 코카인 거물들이 바하마를 통해 마약을 운반했던 과거 역사로 알려져 있어요

translation.en: The owner of the Cay,
he wanted a new reputation for his Cay.
They were told not to use the word "Pablo Escobar"
and then they used that in the first social media tweets.
translation.ko: 그런데 첫 번째 소셜 미디어 트윗에서 사용하고 말았어요

translation.en: The new owner saw the first video promotion
translation.ko: 새 주인이 첫 번째 동영상 홍보 영상을 보고 "과거 파블로 에스코바르의 소유"

translation.en: and he kicked us off in one shot.
Like, no questions asked.
They were kicked off.
Six or eight weeks out,
he had to find a new location on a neighboring Island...
and then start the whole process all over again.
We were constantly trying to move, like, trying to find a new location and trying to find what fits.
translation.ko: 계속해서 이동하면서 우리에게 맞는 장소를 물색했어요

translation.en: Man, it just started to get hectic.
Then I went to another island, until you finally got to Great Exuma,
translation.ko: 그레이트 엑수마에 도착할 때까지 이 섬, 저 섬 전전했어요

translation.en: where it was at least the biggest island in the Exumas
translation.ko: 그레이스 엑수마는 엑수마 섬 중에서 가장 큰 섬으로

translation.en: so it had, you know...
plumbing.
American rapper, singer and actor Ja Rule, also known as Jeffrey Atkins,
translation.ko: 자 룰이라는 이름으로 활동 중인 미국의 래퍼, 가수이자 배우인 제프리 앳킨스가

translation.en: is in the Bahamas with his business partners
translation.ko: 다음 달에 열릴 공연의 세부 사항을 상의하기 위해서

translation.en: to discuss the details of a concert next month.
Fyre was like the thing of the island. Renting so much, rent-a-cars,
translation.ko: 파이어를 모르는 사람이 없었어요 방에 차에 엄청나게 렌트했어요 "메리앤 롤 엑수마 포인트 식당"

translation.en: big jets are flying in.
translation.ko: 큰 비행기가 계속 날아다니고 난리도 아니었죠

translation.en: Everybody was saying, "Hey, that's Fyre, they have lots of money.
They could do anything."
translation.ko: '뭐든지 다 할 수 있대' "파이어 페스티벌 엑수마 경제 활성화 가져와'

translation.en: We hope this is the first of many steps
to bring entertainment and bring value back to the Bahamas.
translation.ko: 많은 경제적 가치를 가져오게 되기를 바라고 있어요

translation.en: I was waiting for some shit like this to happen in the Bahamas, to be real.
translation.ko: 바하마에서 이런 멋진 일이 실제로 일어나기를 바랐어요

translation.en: You know, we never had that many American artists,
translation.ko: 이렇게 많은 미국 아티스트들이 한 무대에 오르는 건 처음이었어요

translation.en: you know, on one stage.
This was supposed to go on for five years, every year.
translation.ko: "추가 출연진, 전체 라인업 곧 공개" 5년 동안 계속된다고 들었어요

translation.en: So, if you do good, you were asked for five years.
translation.ko: 잘만 하면 5년 동안 일이 보장되는 거잖아요 "바하마에서 수백 개의 일자리 창출"

translation.en: You got the contract, so you wanted to live up to the expectations.
[Mark] They had the site.
They let us onto the property...
and we looked at it.
And that's when some of the questions started to rise.
The site...
was on a hill...
and at the base,
what I saw was, pretty much, a housing development
construction site...
that was hazardous in many ways and that needed a lot of work.
translation.ko: "천국에서 살 수 있어요!" 여러 면에서 위험하고 할 일이 많아 보였어요

translation.en: You know there's going to be hiccups, there's gonna be things to be addressed.
translation.ko: 문제도 많고 해결해야 할 일이 많을 거라고 예상했어요

translation.en: It's a first-year festival on an island and you find solutions.
translation.ko: 섬에서 5년 동안 진행될 페스티벌이니 해결책을 찾아야죠 "파이어 페스티벌 그레이트 엑수마 섬"

translation.en: We said, "Here's what you should think about,
you know, here's what your tenting is,
you know, the geodesic domes...
Here's what it's going to cost to set up."
And...
away we went.
What's crazy is they booked the festival
translation.ko: 문제는 그레이스 엑수마 섬에서 일년 중 가장 바쁜 주말에

translation.en: during the busiest weekend of the year on Great Exuma.
It's like the Superbowl there.
It's called the National Regatta,
and the island basically doubles in population size
translation.ko: 섬 인구가 두 배로 늘어나는 시기예요

translation.en: and all of the hotels get booked months, maybe a year in advance.
translation.ko: 모든 호텔이 수개월 수년 전부터 예약이 끝나요

translation.en: Billy had sold a villa package,
and these people were essentially staying in an Airbnb,
so we had to find houses all across the island for 500 guests.
To make it worse, they had oversold
their "Lodge" packages,
which were these tents on the main site.
And then the word comes down from the top
that all influencers will get housing for free.
translation.ko: 모든 인플루언서에게 숙소를 공짜로 주라고 지시했어요

translation.en: So I start calling influencers.
I was the first voice that they had heard
translation.ko: 인플루언서들이 글을 올리고 파이어로부터 처음 받은 전화였어요

translation.en: since they posted.
Each influencer, and there were about 250 influencers,
were promised, for a post,
for one post...
a one-bedroom, three-person villa on the beach...
translation.ko: 세 명이 묵을 수 있는 방 1개짜리 비치 빌라를 주겠다고 약속했어요

translation.en: that didn't exist.
I started talking to Billy...
and from the get-go, it was, you know,
we were all running around, scrambling, every day to find new houses.
"We need help from you guys, start to cut people.
These people aren't paying for the experience.
Tell them not to come."
And it was a constant battle because what they cared most about
translation.ko: 경영진에서 가장 신경 쓰는 건 인플루언서들이라서 계속해서 마찰이 있었어요

translation.en: was the influencers.
So I'm imploring them to cancel paying guests at this point.
translation.ko: 그래서 돈 내고 오는 고객들을 취소해야 한다고 간청했어요

translation.en: "They're not gonna have a place to stay." And the response from Billy was,
"We're not a problems focus group. We're a solutions-oriented group.
We need to have a positive attitude about this. We need a good attitude."
translation.ko: '긍정적인 태도가 필요해요 좋은 태도를 가지도록 해요'

translation.en: And he was unflappable but he was also entirely delusional.
translation.ko: 빌리는 흔들림이 없었어요 완전히 망상에 사로잡혀 있었죠

translation.en: So it was this constant battle in my mind between,
translation.ko: 제 마음 속에서는 끝없이 되묻고 있었어요

translation.en: "Is this guy a genius or is he a madman?"
Because he just would not take "no" for an answer and he wouldn't take advice.
translation.ko: '안 돼'라는 답변은 전혀 듣지 않고 충고도 받아들이지 않았어요

translation.en: [interviewer] Where do you stand now?
He's a liar.
[Calvin] Billy McFarland first got on my radar living here in New York.
translation.ko: 뉴욕에 살 때 빌리 맥팔런드에 대해 처음 알게 됐어요

translation.en: He was running a company called Magnises.
I had a number of friends then that did get the Magnises card
translation.ko: 여러 친구들이 매그니시스 카드를 만들었어요 "캘빈 웰스 금융가"

translation.en: when they started offering
access to elite tickets at a cost well below the market rate.
translation.ko: "비욘세 콘서트" 판매 가격보다 훨씬 낫게 팔기 시작했을 때였어요 "공연 티켓을 250달러에 확보"

translation.en: The whole thing didn't make sense to me.
People that I've spoken to that were cardholders
translation.ko: "밀레니얼 엘리트 전용 클럽 회원 회원비 반환 요구" 카드 소지자들과 얘기해 봤어요

translation.en: recount having their reservations canceled at the last minute,
so it seemed very hard for people to actually
access any of the benefits that they were promised
And so, this guy was always out there, just running hustles...
translation.ko: 이 사람이 하는 걸 보면 말만 그럴듯한

translation.en: that were sort of slick,
but then not necessarily, in my mind, something that was by the book.
I vividly remember the Fyre festival video.
translation.ko: 파이어 페스티벌 동영상을 봤을 때를 정확히 기억해요

translation.en: This video was everywhere on Facebook
and I see a few of the bands that I actually work with
listed as headliners for this festival.
So I immediately called the agents and I say,
"Hey, look, this thing doesn't make sense to me,"
translation.ko: '이거 말도 안 되는 것 같은데요' 했더니

translation.en: and they start saying, "It doesn't make sense to us either.
These guys are promising to pay two X what our market value is."
I say, "Have they sent the money?" and they say, "Funny that you ask,
No, they haven't sent the money for it yet."
I say, "Okay. This is interesting."
translation.ko: 그래서 그냥 지나칠 수 없는 일이라고 생각했죠

translation.en: I take a more active role
translation.ko: 이 페스티벌에서 어떤 일이 일어나고 있는지

translation.en: in investigating everything that was going on with Fyre Festival.
translation.ko: 이 페스티벌에서 어떤 일이 일어나고 있는지 좀 더 적극적으로 알아보기로 결심했어요

translation.en: What I realized was that they had rented an area north of Sandals Resort
and then effectively photoshopped out the bottom portion of the map
to make it look like they were on a deserted island.
translation.ko: 무인도처럼 보이게 속였다는 사실을 알게 되었어요

translation.en: I thought, "The world's gotta know what's going on."
translation.ko: 사람들이 이 사실을 알아야 한다고 생각했어요

translation.en: So I create the now-infamous Twitter account, FyreFraud.
translation.ko: 그래서 악명 높은 '파이어프로드' 트위터 계정을 만들었죠 "파이어 페스티벌 사기"

translation.en: I thought, "Okay, I'm going to put this out there
and people are going to see this
and everyone's going to know it's bogus,"
and nothing happened.
I got maybe two or three clicks on Twitter and that was it.
So I said, "All right, we gotta hit 'em a little harder."
What we ended up doing was taking a plane down there
and photographing the development and what they were working on.
One of the things that really struck me
was that they were erecting these dome tents
that were pitched as "luxury villas" that I realized
were leftover hurricane tents from Hurricane Matthew.
translation.ko: 실은 태풍 매슈가 왔을 때 쓰고 남은 텐트였어요

translation.en: That is a far stretch from a luxury villa on a deserted island.
translation.ko: 무인도의 럭셔리 빌라와는 아주 거리가 멀었죠

translation.en: I realized very quickly that there was no way
translation.ko: 이 사람들이 약속을 지킬 수 있는 방법이

translation.en: that these guys were going to be able to pull this off.
translation.ko: 전혀 없다는 걸 바로 알 수 있었어요

translation.en: [Mark] We were building a city within a city
translation.ko: 도시 안에 새로운 도시를 짓는 거였어요

translation.en: in terms of waste disposal,
in terms of restrooms, water.
It was a fucking shit show,
but we were doing everything that we could possibly do.
translation.ko: 할 수 있는 건 다 하고 있었어요

translation.en: They're frantically building the site.
You know, 100 day laborers working around the clock, no sleep.
translation.ko: 100명의 인부들이 잠도 자지 않고 밤새워 일했어요

translation.en: It was just this mass, big crew of local workers.
Billy paid them off and then he was like, "You know, we need more guys.
translation.ko: 빌리가 임금을 지불하고는 인부가 더 필요하다고 했어요

translation.en: We need more workers."
Billy paid them for the next three days and then...
translation.ko: 다음 3일 동안의 임금을 지불하고 또 다시

translation.en: Billy's like, "Bring more workers. We need more workers."
translation.ko: '사람을 더 데려와요 더 많은 인부가 필요해요'

translation.en: And then it was starting to get too much for me to handle.
translation.ko: 제가 다루기 벅찰 정도로 일이 많아지기 시작했어요

translation.en: They had every living soul on the island of Exuma
translation.ko: 엑수마의 주민 중에서 수건을 들 수 있는 힘이 있으면

translation.en: who could lift a towel, working.
My gosh, there had to have been, probably at some point, 200 people.
translation.ko: 어느 순간 보니 200명 정도가 일하고 있더군요

translation.en: I had to feed all the staff.
Basically, that was taking on the whole Fyre operation under my wings.
translation.ko: 전체 파이어 운영을 제가 맡은 셈이었어요

translation.en: I'd gone down to the Bahamas with some friends
and just coincidentally we actually ran into Ja Rule and Billy down there
translation.ko: 우연히 자 룰과 빌리를 만났어요 "질리어네어 메이저 레이저, 뮤지션"

translation.en: and then they offered to take us on a little tour of the site.
It was beautiful, you know, but it's just like a big giant bluff
overlooking the ocean. There are no buildings, there's no...
translation.ko: 거대한 절벽 같은 곳으로 건물도 없고

translation.en: access to electricity or running water or any of that type of stuff.
We were just kind of like,
concerned, really, there was no infrastructure in place, you know,
but at the same time, they sounded fairly confident about their ability to get this thing done.
translation.ko: 하지만 다 마칠 수 있다고 아주 자신있게 얘기했어요

translation.en: [Samuel] How is it non-negotiable?
When you guys are not the headlining act at a bigger festival,
translation.ko: 더 큰 공연에서 핵심으로 공연하는 게 아니라면

translation.en: you guys don't get top of billing. I mean, in our contract...
translation.ko: 어차피 주목을 받지 못하잖아요 계약서를 보면...

translation.en: I understand. I mean, it's a font size.
translation.ko: 알겠어요, 그건 글꼴 크기 때문에 그래요

translation.en: You had people working 24 hours a day.
I had to work basically two days in one because of Fyre Media
translation.ko: 두 가지 역할을 동시에 해야 했죠 파이어 미디어에서 일하면서

translation.en: and then Fyre Festival.
I noticed the people that were involved in going back and forth to the Bahamas,
translation.ko: 바하마에 왔다 갔다 하며 준비하는 동료들이

translation.en: in the planning, they were becoming growingly frustrated.
They would come to me and like,
"What are you working on with the booking platform?
translation.ko: '섭외 플랫폼 관련해서 무슨 일 하는 거야?

translation.en: I can't wait to get back on this side of the business
because the festival stuff is just becoming chaotic."
We just knew very little about what was happening on the festival side,
translation.ko: 페스티벌 진행에 대해서는 아는 게 별로 없었어요

translation.en: except, you know, the persistent feeling of growing dread.
translation.ko: 두려운 느낌이 계속 커져갔다는 걸 빼곤요

translation.en: Every single day, it got endlessly more tense.
We would be at standstill sometimes for weeks
translation.ko: 가끔씩 수주 동안 일이 중단되곤 했어요

translation.en: not being able to get that final sign off or move through on things
translation.ko: 최종 결제를 받지 못하니 일을 진행할 수가 없었어요

translation.en: because he was completely, you know, succumbed to the festival needs.
translation.ko: 빌리가 완전히 페스티벌에만 열중하고 있었기 때문이죠

translation.en: Spending money at an outrageous cost and speed.
I wasn't sure if it was startup woes, just like "unorganization",
translation.ko: 스타트업이라서 그런 건지 조직이 제대로 구성되지 않아서인지

translation.en: or if it was actually financial trouble, but sometimes payments would be late.
translation.ko: 아니면 재정 문제가 있어서인지 가끔씩 월급이 늦게 들어왔어요

translation.en: Friday afternoon,
our favorite topic is, "Did you get paid and was it for the right amount?"
translation.ko: '월급 받았어? 금액이 제대로 들어 온 거야?' 서로 묻곤 했어요

translation.en: and Michael once was like, "Yeah, I got paid, but it was in a bag of cash."
translation.ko: 마이클이 한번은 그러더군요 '받았는데 현금 뭉치로 줬어'

translation.en: [Andy] I knew that cash flow was becoming an issue,
translation.ko: 현금 흐름이 문제라는 걸 알고 있었지만

translation.en: but Billy handled all the finances.
At that point,
Billy had said, "Listen, we're into this for 25 million bucks.
I'm like, "Oh, my gosh, Billy, jeepers."
The word from people that knew Billy was that he was a magician fundraiser
translation.ko: 빌리를 아는 사람들은 그를 자금 마련의 귀재라고 불렀어요

translation.en: and he just kept pulling money in, somehow.
translation.ko: 어떻게 하는 건지 계속해서 돈을 가져왔어요

translation.en: [Andy] Billy would get on a jet, he'd fly to New York and he'd come back
and somehow have another three million bucks
in his pocket to pull off the next level of needs.
translation.ko: 다음에 필요한 지출을 해결할 수 있었죠

translation.en: [Mick] Carola was one of the many investors.
translation.ko: 캐롤라는 주요 투자자 중 한 명이었어요

translation.en: She was a big believer in Billy.
She was there from his earliest venture, Magnesis, and then Fyre.
translation.ko: 빌리의 초기 사업부터 매그니시스 그리고 파이어까지 함께 했어요

translation.en: She had always been around, always supporting this kid
and always believing in his ability to become the next big entrepreneur.
translation.ko: 빌리가 대단한 사업가로 성장할 거라고 믿고 있었어요

translation.en: We can figure out how to make an extra three, four, five million dollars.
Whether it's higher-tier artist passes,
food and alcohol passes, VIP party passes,
translation.ko: 음식과 술 패스 VIP 파티 패스 등등요

translation.en: the Kendall Jenner yacht party for $10,000 a head for 100 people.
translation.ko: 캔달 제너와 함께 하는 요트 파티를 주최해서 100명에게서 만 달러씩 받을 수 있어요

translation.en: Billy had a vision, you know, and he was definitely thinking
translation.ko: 빌리는 비전이 있었고 페스티벌 성사를 위한 자금을 마련하기 위해서

translation.en: of every little twist that he could come up with
translation.ko: 페스티벌 성사를 위한 자금을 마련하기 위해서 생각해낼 수 있는 모든 아이디어를 동원했어요

translation.en: to raise the money to make it happen.
translation.ko: 생각해낼 수 있는 모든 아이디어를 동원했어요

translation.en: There's two things going for us: one, an audience who has cash,
translation.ko: 우리에겐 두 가지가 있잖아요 현금을 가진 고객이 있고

translation.en: and us, we have the celebrity, we have the island.
There's ways we can monetize both, we're gonna make that happen.
translation.ko: 두 개 다 현금화할 수 있어요 해낼 수 있어요

translation.en: I overheard a conversation,
"Let's put up a cabaña for $50,000 and see if anyone buys it."
translation.ko: '5만 달러에 오두막집을 만들어서 살 사람이 있는지 보자'

translation.en: And I remember thinking, "Do you have a cabaña to sell?
Because I'm feeling concerned that you're not thinking about that
translation.ko: "파이어 비치 클럽 오두막집" 웹 사이트에 라이브로 살 사람을 찾는다고 올리기 전에

translation.en: before you are putting it live on the site for someone to buy."
translation.ko: 이런 생각을 미리 하지 않다니 걱정되었어요

translation.en: [Marc] So, this website came out. It was, like, "fyrecay.com."
And the site's sole purpose was to destroy this festival.
translation.ko: 이 사이트의 유일한 목적은 페스티벌을 망가트리는 것이었죠

translation.en: It was getting fed direct information and photos
of the site that was totally unfinished.
translation.ko: 미완공 현장 사진과 정보가 올라왔어요 "더욱 심각해지네요!"

translation.en: News that was happening by the day that only
translation.ko: 유출된 정보는 페스티벌의 고위 관계자들만 아는 내용이었어요

translation.en: pretty senior people in the festival knew what was happening.
[Martin] It was almost like WikiLeaks.
translation.ko: "이런 상품인 줄 아셨죠? 실제로는 이런 상품이네요!" 거의 위키리크스 같았어요

translation.en: We were having these confidential meetings and then things from that meeting
translation.ko: 비밀리에 했던 회의 내용이 모두 새어나갔어요 단어 하나하나 모두요

translation.en: were actually getting out, word for word.
So we knew someone actually in the meeting had been wired up.
translation.ko: 회의에서 누군가가 도청했다는 걸 알았죠 "말 많으면 실수하는 법 페스티벌 망치겠네!"

translation.en: So we were all called to the war room to have a meeting
translation.ko: "말 많으면 실수하는 법 페스티벌 망치겠네!" 전략 회의에 소집됐는데

translation.en: and it was basically a witch hunt meeting.
It was, "If you are the person
or people that are sending this information to this website,
we will pursue legal action,
you will leave this island, you will not get paid
translation.ko: '한 푼도 받지 못하고 이 섬에서 쫓겨날 거야'

translation.en: and we'll come after you."
The guy that put together Fyrecay was extorting Billy.
translation.ko: 파이어케이를 만든 사람이 빌리를 협박하는 셈이었죠

translation.en: Billy wanted him to take the website down.
translation.ko: 빌리가 웹 사이트를 내려 달라고 요구했지만

translation.en: He said he would only do it if the Fyre Festival
started releasing actual photos of the campsites.
And I just kept saying to Billy,
"We need to get the messaging out now that this is not a luxury music festival.
translation.ko: '럭셔리 음악 페스티벌이 아니라고 사람들에게 지금 얘기해야 해'

translation.en: People aren't staying on yachts, at least, most aren't,
translation.ko: '적어도 대부분의 사람들이 요트에서 묵을 건 아니잖아'

translation.en: many are not staying in villas
and if you can get that messaging out now, we will be able to manage expectations."
translation.ko: '지금이라도 얘기하면 기대 수준을 맞출 수 있을 거네'

translation.en: [Mark] You know? Like here's the reality. Just do it
and people will make their own decisions on it.
But you have got to be honest.
Here's what it is. Here's the tents, you know?
People are going to find out sooner or later, so, like,
why are you walking around... trying to dodge the inevitable?
translation.ko: '왜 피할 수 없는 일을 피하려고 애쓰는 거죠?"

translation.en: [Marc C.] We were gearing up. We were ready to go.
We're, like, going to the gym, having this grand old time.
We would go on these jogs every morning to get ready for Fyre Festival.
translation.ko: 매일 아침에 조깅도 하면서 페스티벌에 갈 준비했어요 "마크 크로포드 페스티벌 참가자"

translation.en: Like, powering around town. "We're going on this great vacation.
We're going to have such a blast.
We're going to meet all these people and have this...
just truly fantastic experience."
I mean, it was so exciting.
[Seth] On April 22nd, I get an email.
"I noticed you hadn't created your Fyreband account yet.
translation.ko: '파이어밴드 계정을 아직 만드시지 않았네요' "세스 크로스노 페스티벌 참가자"

translation.en: It is your wallet for the weekend, so load it appropriately.
translation.ko: '주말에 사용할 지갑 같은 거예요 미리 충전하세요'

translation.en: The majority of our guests have added $3,000 for the weekend.
But if you want to reserve tables or take part in the add-on experiences,
you will want to put on much more."
Billy wanted the engineers to set up payment through this RFID bracelet.
translation.ko: 빌리는 계산이 가능한 전자 태그 팔찌를 개발하도록 엔지니어들에게 지시했어요

translation.en: [Mark] We all said that was insane based on the wireless communication issues.
translation.ko: 우리 모두 무선 통신 문제 때문에 불가능하다고 얘기했죠

translation.en: I mean, this was never tested out.
[Shiyyuan] The urgency wasn't, "Let's make this a cashless experience
translation.ko: 페스티벌 참가자들이 현금을 사용하지 않고도 "음악 외에도 다양한 경험을 할 수 있어요"

translation.en: for our festival attendees."
It was, "We can't put on the Fyre Festival because we don't have any money."
translation.ko: 돈이 부족해서 페스티벌을 개최할 수 없는 상황이었어요

translation.en: I received a call from a woman
asking me, I would say, very aggressively
to put money on my wristband.
They wanted you to buy jet ski things, a private plane.
translation.ko: 제트 스키나 전용 비행기 티켓을 사도록 권했어요

translation.en: [Andy] It was a staggering amount of money. The first batch of kids had loaded...
translation.ko: 깜짝 놀랄 만한 금액이 들어왔어요 첫 기간에 충전된 금액이

translation.en: $800,000 on these wristbands.
You know, you've spent all this money on a ticket,
and now the same amount of money on the wristband, it seemed...
sort of peculiar.
[Marc] So now we're down to probably ten days left to the festival at this point.
They didn't have enough tents and 350 people would have nowhere to stay
translation.ko: 텐트가 여전히 부족했고 350명이 묵을 곳이 없었어요

translation.en: and by the way, houses that we sourced weren't getting paid.
translation.ko: 미리 구해 놓은 집에도 비용을 지급하지 않은 상태였죠

translation.en: So this was now becoming clear that there wasn't any money.
translation.ko: 돈이 없다는 게 명확해졌어요 "파이어 페스티벌 주최측 능력이 부족한가?"

translation.en: Because homeowners were like, "You sent me a wire...
translation.ko: 집주인들이 '5일 전에 돈을 송금한 거 맞아요?'

translation.en: five days ago and I haven't received any funds."
I had an explicit phone call from one of the management team
to stop telling Carola about the housing situation,
translation.ko: 집 문제로 캐롤라에게 전화하지 말라는 것이었어요

translation.en: because they were trying to get more money from her...
translation.ko: 캐롤라에게 돈을 더 투자 받으려고 하는 중인데

translation.en: and that my emails were alarming her...
translation.ko: 캐롤라에게 이런 이메일이 가면 놀란다는 이유였어요

translation.en: and they outright told me to be dishonest.
translation.ko: 그러니까 정직하게 대하지 말라는 요구였죠 "파트너를 이메일에 포함하지 마, 돈 문제가 생긴다고"

translation.en: And you have to realize I got paid 30% of my fee, so they're hanging--
My fee's not due until the day of the event,
translation.ko: 나머지는 행사가 끝나야 받을 수 있는 거라

translation.en: so they're hanging 70% of my fee over my head like a carrot.
translation.ko: 그 70%를 받아야 한다는 생각에 채찍질 당하는 기분이었어요

translation.en: [Andy] Every day, something else would happen.
Every hour, something else would happen.
Every minute, there'd be another obstacle.
We had a $6 million contract
with Star Catering to handle all the food service
and we only had $1 million allocated.
And Billy fired them over the phone.
And then he hung up the phone. I stood there and he said...
"Can you salvage this?"
And I said, "Oh, my gosh, I have two weeks to come up...
with food service for 6,000 kids? This is going to be fascinating."
translation.ko: '6,000명이 먹을 음식을 어떻게 해결하지, 어려운 일이야'

translation.en: Grant, who was on the call,
pulled out the proposal from Star and said,
"I told them I wanted sushi chefs coming in,"
and, "I needed to see Indian cuisine,"
and I thought, "Gosh, Grant, you've missed the boat here."
We are not spending $6 million, we can only spend $1 million
and I'm eliminating all of that."
At this point in time,
there had been no progress pictures, no updated videos.
translation.ko: 진행 상황을 보여주는 사진이나 동영상은 없었어요

translation.en: They were using the same footage and photographs
from that first promotional video
in all of the subsequent promotional content.
The media and marketing companies in New York,
we didn't have any visibility into what was happening on the production side.
translation.ko: 프로덕션 현장에서 어떤 일이 일어나는지 전혀 알지 못했어요

translation.en: We're building out this vision that was based around this kind of visual facade.
translation.ko: 이런 시각적인 자료만을 가지고 비전을 만들거든요

translation.en: [Mark C.] We noticed quite quickly that all of the original sketches of the rooms
that we had signed up for got taken off the page.
That was sort of when we started trying to dig a little bit more and see,
translation.ko: 그때부터 좀 더 깊숙이 알아보기 시작했죠

translation.en: "Oh, can you send us pictures of the accommodations?"
translation.ko: '숙소 사진 좀 보내줄래요?' "필요한 거 가지고 가려고요"

translation.en: You had people asking very legitimate questions on Instagram.
They were trying to book flights, trying to understand logistics.
translation.ko: "도움 받을 수가 없네요" 비행기 표를 예약하고 진행 정보를 알고 싶어했어요

translation.en: [Mick] We just started getting bombarded with all these questions.
translation.ko: "답장 좀 보내 줄..." 질문들이 폭주하기 시작했어요

translation.en: Grant was trying to use our employees for customer service,
translation.ko: 그랜트가 직원들로 고객 서비스를 하려고 했지만 "최신 정보가 없어 답변할 수 없어요"

translation.en: but that wasn't what we were hired to do.
translation.ko: "최신 정보가 없어 답변할 수 없어요" 전문 인력이 아니라 제대로 하지 못했죠

translation.en: The only thing we could do was to just keep telling people,
"Email concierge@fyre.com."
And then we would get another request saying,
"concierge@fyre.com didn't respond."
The unanswered questions turned to people criticizing...
[Mark C.] It was very annoying.
I was like, "This is terrible customer service.
They need to know better. They're throwing this luxury festival..."
translation.ko: 럭셔리 페스티벌이라면서 더 잘해야 하지 않나요

translation.en: [Mick] And then you'd have Grant reaching outand saying,
translation.ko: "아직 답변하지 않은 댓글이 많네요" 그럼 그랜트가 연락해서는

translation.en: "These comments are killing us.
What do we do about all the people that are talking shit?"
The decision was to screenshot all of the legitimate questions
translation.ko: 그래서 내린 결정이 합당한 질문을 모두 캡처해서

translation.en: and forward that over to the Fyre team
and then delete all of the negative comments
translation.ko: 브랜드를 비하하는 모든 부정적인 댓글을 삭제하고요

translation.en: that were degrading the brand.
I saw them actively deleting comments
and then turning comments off entirely
so that you wouldn't have 3,000 people saying,
"Hey, I don't have my flight information. Where do I need to go?"
translation.ko: '비행기 정보가 없어요 어디로 가야 하죠?' "어느 공항에 도착해야 하죠?"

translation.en: So as me and Billy was riding back towards the site...
You know, he was like.... Kinda like panicky look, you know?
So he's like, "What do you think? You think we can get this done?
I said, "What do you mean?"
"You think we can get everything done before Thursday?"
So...
Me saying to myself right there, I say,
"You want to lie to him or you just want to speak the truth?"
'Cause sometimes the truth can come pretty,
and then sometimes the truth can just come ugly.
So, I was like,
"Billy, being honest, I think we could do it.
translation.ko: '빌리, 솔직히 말해서 할 수 있을 것 같아요'

translation.en: But we need some more time. We need to do some overtime
translation.ko: '시간이 더 필요해요 연장 작업도 해야 하고요'

translation.en: and we need to just push... We need to do more hours."
[Andy] Every day we met, every day, we would talk about,
translation.ko: 매일 만날 때마다 같은 얘기를 했어요

translation.en: "Okay, should we pull the plug or should we keep this thing going?"
And every day, Billy would say,
translation.ko: 그럼 빌리는 매일 같은 얘기를 하죠

translation.en: "We can't pull the plug. We've got to keep this thing going."
"You can't have people come, this is not going to work."
translation.ko: '안 될 줄 알면서 사람들을 오게 할 수는 없어요'

translation.en: Verbatim. It was like...
"If you want to leave, you can leave.
If you're not going to leave, we're here to find solutions."
And I would step outside, right after each meeting,
literally go out on the porch and burst into tears.
Never in my career did I ever do this, but there I would be, thinking,
translation.ko: 지금까지 일을 하면서 이래 본 적이 없어요

translation.en: "Holy shit."
[Marc] So I sent an email.
"Guys, we're running out of time.
I've tried to warn you multiple times, but my words have fallen on deaf ears.
translation.ko: '여러 번 경고하려고 했지만 아무도 내 말을 듣지 않았어요'

translation.en: We are one day out without enough beds to safely house
translation.ko: '이제 하루 남았는데 직원과 VIP 손님, 유료 고객을'

translation.en: our staff, our VIP guests and our paid customers.
You need to cancel more guests, immediately."
I was basically like, "I know that you're worried about press blowback,
but imagine a scenario where 350 people arrive onto a remote island,
are herded onto yellow school buses,
brought to a festival site that's unfinished
and realize they've no place to sleep
and to make it worse, they have no way to get home,
translation.ko: '설상가상으로 집에 갈 방법이 없다고 상상해 보세요'

translation.en: because we don't have any charter flights booked back for them.
I know you're worried about the press, but there's no worse situation than that."
translation.ko: '언론에 대해 걱정하는 건 알겠지만 이게 더 심각해요'

translation.en: And the response?
The response was,
"At least they'll see your smiling face and yoga skills."
translation.ko: '적어도 당신의 웃는 얼굴과 요가 기술을 볼 수 있잖아요'

translation.en: 'Cause I was supposed to be the yoga instructor for the event.
translation.ko: 제가 요가 강습을 하기로 돼 있었거든요

translation.en: Okay.
Like, what am I supposed to do? You know? Like, I'm...
"All right, sure."
Billy was under such immense financial pressure
translation.ko: 빌리는 엄청난 재정적 압박을 받고 있었어요

translation.en: that he effectively had to put this festival on
because otherwise he wasn't going to be able to repay
any of the factor receivables that he had raised money from.
It's the same thing as an individual going to a loan shark.
No matter what happened, this money was going to be owed.
They had told investors who had already given money
translation.ko: "빌리 맥팔런드는 24시간 내에 돈을 갚아야 한다" 돈을 빌려준 투자자들에게

translation.en: that, in the event of a cancellation, that they would be covered
when in fact they weren't.
And they didn't have festival insurance, so canceling really wasn't an option.
translation.ko: 페스티벌 보험에 든 적이 없어서 취소할 수 있는 상황이 아니었어요

translation.en: [Marc] I mean, this was truly a disaster.
And events always feel like a disaster.
They always feel like everything's going wrong and you're putting out fires.
translation.ko: 뭔가 잘못될 것 같고 늘 불을 끄는 기분이죠

translation.en: The draw, the appeal was to be part of creating something that was special.
translation.ko: 이 페스티벌은 무언가 특별한 것을 만든다는 매력이 있었어요

translation.en: And that desire overcame my inner wisdom, which was like, "This is a mess."
translation.ko: 그런 욕망 때문에 상황이 엉망이라는 생각이 들어도 어쩔 수 없었던 것이죠

translation.en: The atmosphere that was cultivated there was that...
nobody, no matter what,
was able to cross them and tell them, "No."
Had we not pulled off these kind of crazy things
like Andy finding this caterer with no time left,
translation.ko: 케이터링을 해결해야 하는 것처럼 이런 미친 행동을 하지 않았더라면

translation.en: then there would've been no festival.
It's possible that by solving problems,
we were just enabling them to continue to create this monster.
[interviewer] Did Andy ever tell you how he had to get the water out?
Oh, yeah.
Did Andy tell you how they had to get the water out?
translation.ko: 앤디가 어떻게 물을 빼냈는지 정말 얘기하던가요?

translation.en: Yeah.
It was, like, fucking crazy.
I'm not going to talk about that. [laughing]
Let me tell you something. We had...
four containers filled...
Four 18-wheeler trucks filled with Evian water,
translation.ko: 에비앙 물로 가득 찬 네 개의 대형 트럭이 있었어요

translation.en: but I had left the week before for two days
to go to meetings in Bermuda for the America's Cup.
And when I came back, I'd missed the big meeting with Customs,
translation.ko: 돌아오니 세관과 있었던 중요한 회의가 이미 끝났더군요

translation.en: and of course Customs had said to Billy and the gang,
"You need to pay us $175,000 in cash today
for us to release the water."
I went down.
Well, Billy called me.
I'm gonna speak completely, you know...
This won't go that far, I'm sure, but...
Billy called and said, "Andy, we need you to take one big thing for the team."
translation.ko: 빌리가 전화해서는 팀을 위해서 중요한 일을 맡아달라고 했어요

translation.en: And I said...
"My gosh, I've been taking something for the team every day."
translation.ko: '이런, 팀을 위해서 매일 중요한 일을 이미 하고 있네'

translation.en: He said, "Well, you're our wonderful gay leader,
and we need you to go down. Will you...
suck...
dick...
to fix this water problem?"
And I said, "Billy, what?" And he said, "Andy,
translation.ko: '빌리, 지금 뭐라고 했어?' '앤디, 커닝햄의 거시기를 빨아주고'

translation.en: if you will go down and suck Cunningham's dick,
who's the head of Customs,
and get him to clear all of the containers with water,
you will save this festival."
And I literally drove home, took a shower,
I drank some mouthwash.
I'm like, "Oh my gosh, I'm really..." And I got into my car
to drive across the island to take one for the team...
translation.ko: 섬을 가로질러 가서 팀을 위해 해결할 생각이었어요

translation.en: and I got to his office, fully prepared to suck his dick.
translation.ko: 사무실에 들어갔고 일을 치를 준비가 됐는데

translation.en: He couldn't have been nicer. He's like, "Andy, listen,
I will release all the water, I will let you serve it,
but I want to be want to be one of the first people to be paid
this import fee for what you're doing," and I said, "Okay, great."
And I got back and I had all the water that we needed.
Can you imagine, in my 30 years of a career,
that this is what I was going to do?
translation.ko: 이런 일까지 해야 한다는 게 말이 되나요?

translation.en: I was going to do that, honestly, to save the festival.
translation.ko: 솔직히 페스티벌을 살릴 수만 있다면 할 생각이었어요

translation.en: Major news in the vlog today. Tomorrow morning, 5:30,
translation.ko: 오늘 브이로그의 주요 소식은 내일 아침 5시 30분에

translation.en: half of the Jerry Media crew is going to Fyre Festival in Bahamas
translation.ko: 제리 미디어의 팀원 절반이 바하마의 무인도에서 열리는 "제임스 올리거 제리 미디어"

translation.en: on a remote island.
We've been doing their marketing for the last couple of months,
so excited to see this thing take off.
translation.ko: 행사를 직접 보게 되니 너무 기쁘네요

translation.en: I think it's going to be f... epic.
We went down with about four of the teammates
translation.ko: 페스티벌 전 날에 팀원 네 명이랑

translation.en: the day before the festival.
Mick, the good news about this plane? If we want to leave, just...
translation.ko: 이 비행기 좀 보실래요? 밖으로 나가려면

translation.en: take the window off and just head out.
This is great. This is a great flight.
I remember the feeling, getting off the plane, we were so excited.
"Finally here, this is happening."
There's literally no cars on the island.
We couldn't rent one. They didn't hook us up with one, so...
translation.ko: 렌트할 수도 없었죠 준비해 준 차도 없고요

translation.en: this is us. We're hitch-hiking for the next couple of days.
I was down there yesterday
and I said, "Man, this ain't gonna be finished for no Friday."
So much work, so much things!
And so little time.
So, none of this was here. All this sand is new.
-This was all put down... -[James] Yeah, I can tell.
translation.ko: - 다 가져다 채운 거예요 - 네, 그래 보여요

translation.en: ...a few days ago. Can you?
[Marc] It's all peaking on this last day because it's going to happen.
translation.ko: 페스티벌이 열릴 거였고 마지막 날이 절정이었어요

translation.en: We all know now that this is an inevitability,
translation.ko: 어쩔 수 없이 열릴 거란 걸 다들 알고 있었죠

translation.en: that this event is going to happen, no matter what.
translation.ko: 어떤 일이 있든지 행사가 진행되어야만 했죠

translation.en: I'm working with this Navy SEAL
who's telling me this is like a clusterfuck.
That's what he called it. "An elephant of a clusterfuck."
He's laughing and not even laughing,
translation.ko: 비웃으며 얘기했는데 그냥 비웃는 정도가 아니라

translation.en: just disturbed at how fucked up this is and...
and he's a Navy SEAL, like, come on!
The last 24 hours were unbelievable.
All I kept thinking about was Woodstock.
Think of that music festival.
Does anybody talk about the hundreds and hundreds of cars
that were stuck on the thruway for days?
translation.ko: 수천 대의 차에 대해서는 얘기하지 않죠

translation.en: Does anybody talk about the mudslides?
How many people died of drug overdoses? Does anybody talk about the lack of food?
translation.ko: 얼마나 많은 사람들이 마약 과다 복용으로 사망했죠? 음식 부족에 대해 얘기하는 사람이 있었나요?

translation.en: Almost no water.
Absolutely not. And I thought, "You know what?
If Woodstock could get through that and, from a publicity perspective,
land where it did,
FyreFestival can make it."
Well, actually we didn't sleep that night.
'cause I remember exactly what happened, so...
we're standing outside on the porch of this mansion,
looking out at the ocean and it's a full moon or something
and it starts...
pouring rain.
Pouring rain.
Thunder and lightning.
And we just start laughing.
Like, belly laughs...
and look at each other and...
To this point, I'm so delirious
that I still am not sure that this is 100% entirely true,
but I remember one of our group saying,
translation.ko: 근데 갑자기 한 사람이 이런 말을 했어요

translation.en: "At least they won't get away with it now."
I honestly remember that and I don't know that that's--
But that's what I remember.
So you have to realize the site's unfinished.
There's mattresses all over the place getting soaked.
translation.ko: 매트리스가 여기저기 있는데 비에 흠뻑 젖었어요

translation.en: Any tent that was done is now unlivable.
translation.ko: 완성된 텐트는 지낼 수 없는 지경이 되었죠

translation.en: And the guests are still coming.
And we have nowhere to put them.
[J.R.] The rainstorm that morning killed us.
Because I know the work we had done that morning and...
I could have cried.
I think I did. [laughs]
The other funny thing that happened was we were laughing and we were like,
translation.ko: 또 웃긴 일은 웃으면서 우리가 그렇게 얘기했거든요

translation.en: "Well at least nothing is on time in the Bahamas.
At least this rain... The guests will be late."
They were supposed to come at 6:50, the first flight got there at 6:20.
It was like a sick joke.
So...
So... [chuckling]
Fyre Festival, baby. Here we go.
About to go to...
Miami.
Miami for, like, four hours. And then where are we going?
-Bahamas. -Bahamas.
Check out my ice, baby.
Bahamas. We're coming for you, baby.
We are here in the... "private jet."
We thought we were going to get on one of those propeller planes,
like a tiny little propeller plane
that was in all of the video footage.
I didn't realize what plane we were going to be on until we were boarded.
translation.ko: 탑승하기 전까지 어떤 비행기를 타게 될지 몰랐어요

translation.en: And, I mean, it was like a 737.
My understanding, it was supposed to be this "branded jet experience,"
translation.ko: 파이어의 전용 제트기를 타는 것으로 이해했어요

translation.en: which I think was a...
I don't know where they got it from. It was just... [laughs]
"Oh, let's slap a logo on it and call it a day" type of thing.
translation.ko: '비행기에 로고 하나 붙이고 이걸로 끝!' 이렇게 했을걸요?

translation.en: It's actually worse than, like, really...
Like being low economy class.
[Seth] It was about 4:30 when we're getting on the plane,
and that's when my friend looked at his phone and said,
"Blink-182 just pulled out.
Do you still want to get on the plane?"
And their reasoning wasn't anything like,

translation.ko: "원하는 수준의 공연을 할 수 있는 환경인지 잘 모르겠습니다"

translation.en: It was just like, "We don't think we can put on the show that our fans would deserve."
translation.ko: '팬들에게 좋은 공연을 선사할 수 없을 것 같아' 정도였죠

translation.en: I've never been to a Blink-182 concert so I don't even know what that means.
translation.ko: 블링크-182 공연에 가본 적이 없어서 무슨 말인지 모르겠더군요

translation.en: So we were like, "It will be fine."
[Justin] We all got off and landed on this beautiful island.
Still, nothing seemed amiss.
I do remember being presented a choice.
translation.ko: 둘 중 하나를 고르라고 물어봤던 게 기억나요

translation.en: "Do you want to go to the campsite or do you want to go to this restaurant,
translation.ko: '캠핑장에 가실래요? 아니면 이 식당으로 가실래요?' "저스틴 리아오 페스티벌 참가자"

translation.en: this beachside restaurant?"
An executive decision was made, I don't know by who,
translation.ko: 누가 내린 건지 모르겠지만 경영진에서 결정을 내렸어요

translation.en: but it was to essentially close down the campsite

It was never planned. I knew of it, like, maybe 25 minutes

Tons of buses, bussing in hundreds of their guests.
translation.ko: 수십 대의 버스들이 수백 명의 손님들을 실어날랐어요

translation.en: And they were asking, "Is this the Fyre Festival?"
They all thought that they were at the first step
translation.ko: 모두들 멋진 페스티벌의 첫 단계가 시작하는 거라고

translation.en: of what was going to be a very exciting experience.
It's on this, like, beautiful beach.
A dock goes all the way out,
people are just dangling their legs, having tequila.
I'm looking around and I'm like, "This is the greatest decoy of all time."
The music playing, and the guests was just cheering on.
translation.ko: 음악이 흐르고 손님들의 흥이 오르고 있었죠

translation.en: They were dancing and having a good time.
[Mick] There was a lot of smiles and a lot of happiness over at this other bar.

translation.ko: 솔직히 전체 페스티벌에서 최고의 순간이었을 거예요

[woman] Oh, my God.
They're soaking wet!
[Mick] The tents are soaked, mud is sliding on the carpets.
translation.ko: 텐트도 젖고 진흙이 카페트 위까지 차올랐어요

translation.en: What was already this kind of very loosely put together festival,

[Marc] We didn't have enough drivers, we didn't have enough houses,

we didn't have enough staff.
It was just... We were overwhelmed.
So I'm getting phone calls. I'm trying to charge my phone,

translation.ko: 블루 프로덕션 하우스에서 절 찾는 전화가 왔어요

translation.ko: 갔더니 완전 아수라장이었어요 여기저기서 소리치고 있었어요

translation.ko: 아직도 밖에서는 무언가를 지으려고 하고 있었고요

I was like, "Okay, get your shit done."
I'm literally getting now physically pulled

translation.ko: 제 몸을 붙잡고 끌어 당기기 시작했어요

translation.en: "Marc, this person arrived, that person arrived.
translation.ko: '마크, 이 사람 도착했어요 저 사람 도착했어요'

translation.en: We need to find them houses."
I thought something was wrong

Kinda funneling tequila down our throats.
They started asking,
"Where can I go? Where do we go?"
"How are we getting to the campsite? Where is the campsite?
Where's my luggage?"
And I was like,
"What do I tell them?"
You know, Billy would be in the room and he'd be kind of the CEO,
translation.ko: 빌리는 방에 있었어요 결정을 내려야 하는

translation.en: calling the shots.
Every now and then, he would walk out, go get on his four-wheeler,

Just take off.
And then he would come right back and walk back in without, you know,
a lot to talk about, but you could see he just had like bottled up energy.
translation.ko: 별말 없이 방으로 들어갔어요 에너지를 다 써버린 것 같았어요

translation.en: It's time to let people in
and kind of see how it unfolds.
[Marc C.] There was no one from Fyre Festival on the bus.
translation.ko: 버스에 파이어 페스티벌 관계자는 아무도 없었어요

translation.en: The bus driver just knew where to go, and he's telling us,
translation.ko: 버스 기사는 도착지만 알고 있었어요 '한 달 전에야 공사를 시작했어요'

translation.en: "Oh, yeah, they didn't start construction on any of this until maybe a month ago."
Or, "Oh, yeah, you're really in for something.

translation.ko: '어떤 곳에 왔는지 가서 보면 알 거요'

translation.en: Which is a very concerning thing to hear when you're on a bus

translation.en: to you have no idea where

Turn around!
Turn this bus right around!

A lot of people thought, "Maybe we're passing through this area.

translation.ko: 그런데 운전 기사가 말했죠 '아니, 저기가 묵는 곳이에요'

translation.en: It was like, "Oh, my God!"
-[woman] Look at the beds! -[man] Oh, Jesus!
This festival is never happening again, I hope they know that.

translation.ko: 버스 기사가 이 늪 지역을 한 바퀴 돌아줬어요

translation.en: and we get to that blue house that I guess was their headquarters,
translation.ko: 주최 본부가 있다고 하는 블루 하우스에 도착했더니

translation.en: and there was just a line of hundreds of people.
translation.ko: 수백 명의 사람들이 줄을 서 있었어요

translation.en: [woman] We have literally been standing here for, like, an hour.
translation.ko: 한 시간 정도 여기에 서 있었어요

Billy came up to me and told me to just blast the music.
translation.ko: 빌리가 제게 와서 음악을 틀라고 얘기했어

translation.en: As loud as I possibly could.
That's one of the most annoying parts. You could just hear this pulsating noise.
translation.ko: 짜증나는 것 중 하나가 시끄럽게 틀어대는 음악이었어요

translation.en: And so we would lower the music.
After five minutes, Billy would come back.
"Raise the music."
Everyone was, like, arguing, you know?
Everyone was making noise or like, "Where I'm gonna stay?

The attendees were looking towards anything, anyone for direction.
translation.ko: 참가자들은 어떤 안내를 바라며 무엇이든, 누구든 바라봤어요

translation.en: Guys, stay here.
[Seth] Billy McFarland stood up on a table.

translation.ko: 내가 가까이 가서 빌라를 선택한 사람은 어디에서 묵냐고 물으니

translation.ko: 빌라를 선택한 사람은 비어 있는 텐트를 사용하라고 했어요

I was like, "It's a free-for-all."
[Justin] Everybody started sprinting, running to their tents, grabbing bags.
[Mark] We heard this voice,
we heard this rush, then we heard the screaming.
We walked out and there was just this mass of people going to tents.
[CC] It's an absolute circus. I don't know what's going on.
translation.ko: 정말 아수라장이었어요 도대체 무슨 일인지 모르겠어요 "CC 클라크 인플루언서"

translation.en: I'm not getting off this ship until I know what's going on there.
translation.ko: 무슨 일인지 알아낼 때까지는 이 배에서 안 나갈 거예요

translation.en: [woman] It's 8:36 and people are now just getting their luggage.

translation.ko: 플라스틱으로 만든 건데 저기에 귀중품을 넣어두래요

translation.en: [Justin] There was no one who planned out luggage tags.
translation.ko: 가방 태그를 준비한 사람은 없었나 봐요

translation.en: They brought out the luggage in two big containers.
translation.ko: 두 개의 컨테이너에 짐을 담아 왔어요

translation.en: Like truck containers. Eighteen-wheeler containers.
They just said, "Everyone, grab your bag." And it was just a frenzy.
translation.ko: 가방 가져가라고 하네요 광란의 현장이 따로 없었어요

translation.en: [Marc C.] Everyone was just looking for, you know,
their black bag amongst a sea of black bags.
translation.ko: 검정색 가방을 찾고 있었는데 가방이 보통 다 검은색이잖아요

translation.en: And if they had to climb over you
translation.ko: 가방을 가져오기 위해서 누군가를 밟고 올라가야 한다면

translation.en: and stomp over you to get their piece of luggage, so be it.
translation.ko: 가방을 가져오기 위해서 누군가를 밟고 올라가야 한다면 그렇게 해야 했어요

translation.en: This is an absolute disaster.
Where do you-- Yo!
We do not want to be on the perimeter, I promise you.
[Justin] We didn't want neighbors.
Our strategy from there was to kind of ransack
all the tents around us.
Just started poking holes and flipping mattresses.
translation.ko: 구멍을 내고 매트리스를 뒤집어 놓기 시작했죠

translation.en: My buddy pissed on a few of the beds.
translation.ko: 내 친구는 몇몇 매트리스에 소변을 보기도 했어요

translation.en: [Columbo] Shit got crazy.
People was just walking with mattresses on top of their head.
translation.ko: 사람들이 머리 위로 메트리스를 올리고 걸어다녔어요

translation.en: Walking from this one around to that one.
[Marc C.] It became this looting mentality.
One woman had a whole pallet of toilet paper.
translation.ko: 한 여자는 화장실 휴지를 운반 상자 가득 가지고 있었고

translation.en: Somebody else had this whole giant box of pillows
that she was lugging back to her tent.
It became very barbaric, in a sense.
[Mark] Driving around, it was the most eerie feeling in the world.
There was no lights.
[Mick] It looked like a horror scene.
People were scattered throughout that area and spent one night.
translation.ko: 사람들이 여기저기 흩어져서 하룻밤을 보내고 있었어요

translation.en: My guess is most of them never went to sleep.
[Mark C.] Some woman came in
in a panic at one point in the dead of night.
She couldn't find her friend.
She was lost, she seemed like she was drunk. I mean...
translation.ko: 길을 잃었다고 하는데 술에 취한 것 같았어요

translation.en: But there's nothing you can do to help a person like that.
translation.ko: 술이 취한 사람을 도울 방법이 없었어요

translation.en: You know, I don't know where I am either.
And there was a definite turning point, I would say,
when the sun went down, when the camaraderie was over.
[Mark] All I know is that, by the end of the night,
translation.ko: 제가 아는 거라고는 밤이 끝나갈 무렵

translation.en: all of the tents were full.
And this is with one-third of the guests we were supposed to have.
translation.ko: 원래는 이들 중 삼분의 일 정도만 묵기로 한 숙소였는데 말이죠

translation.en: [Mick] I remember just leaving this place
and looking at this image of the campground
for the first time feeling what an epic failure really is.
[Seth] So, as I was tweeting about the event,
translation.ko: "어디로 갈지 아무도 몰라 빌라는 없고, 최악의 캠핑장이야" 트윗을 올리기 시작했어요 '이게 지금 상황이야'

translation.en: just to be like, "This is what's going on."
I mean, "Here's the lockers, here's the concierge stand.
This is what Fyre Festival is."
The tweets just started going viral.
It was just kind of the perfect thing to consume in real-time.
translation.ko: "모든 사람들의 짐이 다 젖었어" 실시간으로 읽기에 완벽한 스토리였죠 "완전히 혼란 상태야 텐트에 난리가 났어"

translation.en: Then I saw the Twitter post.
The cheese sandwich.
That was when I knew this was done.
I remember The New York Times came out with an article
translation.ko: "리트윗 좋아요" '뉴욕 타임스'에서 파이어 페스티벌 전반에 대한

translation.en: that talked about this entire Fyre Festival.
[Mick] They talked about it very matter-of-fact,
translation.ko: "산산조각 난 파이어 페스티벌 분노, 소송, 조사"

translation.en: from an operational perspective.
What they didn't talk about, which I think was something that was missed,
translation.ko: "1시간 동안의 트윗 수" 이 기사에서 놓친 부분이 있다면 이런 거였죠

translation.en: was a couple of powerful models posting an orange tile
translation.ko: 몇몇 인기 모델들이 오렌지 타일을 게시함으로써

translation.en: is what essentially built this entire festival,
and then one kid with probably 400 followers
translation.ko: 400명 정도의 팔로워가 있는 한 젊은이가 올린

translation.en: posted a picture of cheese on toast
translation.ko: 치즈와 토스트 사진 한 장이 입소문을 타면서

translation.en: that trended and essentially ripped down the festival.
All I know is that people were stoked to watch this thing go down.
translation.ko: 이 페스티벌이 취소되는 걸 보면서 사람들이 기뻐했어요

translation.en: [Gabrielle] There definitely was kind of like
almost a gleeful response on social media from people that weren't there.
The way that it seemed like it happened is funny, you know?
translation.ko: "모두 파이어에서 즐겁다고요, 이상!" 조금 웃기는 면이 있긴 하죠

translation.en: A Lord of the Flies situation with, you know, Instagram's top influencers.
translation.ko: "루콜라 준다고 했잖아요" 유명 인플루언서가 '파리 대왕' 상황에 처한 것도 그렇고요 "파이어 페스티벌의 최근 모습"

translation.en: [Mick] Grant was still calling orders and asking us to do things.
translation.ko: 그랜트가 계속 전화하면서 이런저런 일을 지시했어요

translation.en: I said, "No, Grant, we're not posting any more promises.
translation.ko: "그랜트, 더 이상 약속하는 글을 올릴 수 없어요"

translation.en: We're not trying to propel this vision any further."
translation.ko: "글 올리기 전에 피해 상황을 파악해요" "돌이킬 수 없는 상황이라면 완전히 책임져요"

translation.en: You know, "This thing is dead."
Then I think, like, three minutes later, I get a text from Grant
introducing me to their new social media team.
translation.ko: 새로운 소셜 미디어 팀에 저를 소개하면서

translation.en: "Can you please send him over the credentials?"
I just remember calling Ja - he wasn't even there yet -
and saying, like, "There's, like, no way this is happening.
I'm sending out the email. I really don't care at this point."
translation.ko: '이메일을 보낼 거야 더 이상 신경 안 써'

translation.en: And then I told Billy I cancelled the acts
translation.ko: 빌리에게 진행 중이던 일들을 취소했다고 말했어요

translation.en: and at that point, he knew everything had fallen apart already.
translation.ko: 그 상황에서는 빌리도 이미 모든 게 끝났다는 걸 알고 있었죠

translation.en: And he was pacing back and forth out on the terrace.
I could see that there were tears in his eyes,
but that was the first time that any of us had seen that.
Through thick and thin,
he stayed so positive and it wasn't until that day...
that things started to crumble, that he really started to get it.
translation.ko: 모든 게 무너지기 시작했어요 빌리가 상황 파악을 한 거죠

translation.en: [Mick] I mean, he went from, two days before,
thinking he was the entrepreneur of our decade
to essentially being a massive viral disgrace and joke.
[Marc] I go into the production house, and, like, Grant's crying
translation.ko: 프로덕션 하우스에 들어가보니 그랜트가 울고 있었어요

translation.en: and Carola just looks like she's been like hit by a truck.
translation.ko: 캐롤라는 트럭에 친 것 같은 표정을 하고 있었고요

translation.en: Grant stayed and he was talking about drafting up their official response
translation.ko: 그랜트가 현재 상황에 대한 공식 입장을 작성하겠다고 했어요

translation.en: to what had happened, and it was like, "Due to circumstances out of our control,"
and I remember Jorge looks at him and he's like, "Do not lie again.
This is your chance to tell the truth.
"Don't say 'out of our control.' This was perfectly in our control."
translation.ko: '통제할 수 없었다고 말하지 마! 통제할 수 있는 상황이었잖아'

translation.en: [James] Major update.
Fyre Festival is officially cancelled.
-Just got the news, guys. -[woman] Officially?
translation.ko: - 지금 막 들었어 - 공식적으로 취소된 거야?

translation.en: -[man] Is it really? -It's what Mick said.
Apparently, there's no food on the island. They're not letting people in.
translation.ko: 섬에 음식이 없어요 사람들을 더 받아들이지 않고요

translation.en: [Gabrielle] People who just landed here have to go back to Miami.
translation.ko: 막 도착한 사람들은 마이애미로 돌아가야 해요

translation.en: They were just trying to get out at that point.
Part of the problem was that there weren't planes to take them out
and the airport was totally overwhelmed with all these people
and they eventually locked them in
translation.ko: 그래서 결국 이 사람들을 공항에 가뒀죠

translation.en: and kept them overnight without any food or water.♪
translation.ko: 음식도 물도 없이 밤새 갇혀 있었어요

translation.en: Okay. How long until water comes?
And food.
[man] When do we get our money back?
It was just this sort of real-time saga
translation.ko: 이건 완전히 실시간으로 펼쳐지는 모험 같아요

translation.en: that started at six o'clock in the afternoon.
And in the morning, the media started picking it up.
[reporter 1] This morning, the organizers of the failed Fyre Festival
translation.ko: 오늘 아침 실패로 끝난 파이어 페스티벌의 주최자들이

translation.en: are feeling the heat.
We took a big jump here, a big risk,
translation.ko: 커다란 시도를 했고 큰 위험을 감수했지만

translation.en: and V1 has failed.
People were making fun of it, making fun of us.
[Conan] Do you feel bad for the people that did spend money and go to this--
translation.ko: "파이어 페스티벌: 입장료만 4,000달러, 놀려도 괜찮아요" 이 돈을 쓰고 여기에 간 사람들이 안됐다고 생각해요?

translation.en: If you had thousands of dollars to go on a trip to see Blink-182...
translation.ko: 수천 달러를 내고 블링크-182 공연을 보러 갈 정도라면

translation.en: that's on you. That is Darwinism at its finest.
translation.ko: 알아서 하세요 팔자 좋은 사람들 아닌가요

translation.en: [Luca] At that point, all of their promises started to collapse,
so the car rental companies came and took the keys,
translation.ko: 차 렌트 회사들이 와서 키를 가져갔고

translation.en: the house owners came and demanded that their properties were returned.
[Andy] One of my head construction guys came to me and said, "Andy,
I need $26,000 in cash,
and I want it right now."
He was a big guy and he followed me.
And then I went back to the tent and he followed me.
I had the head of the Bahamian Tourism Board,
the Minister of Finance
and the head of the University of the Bahamas
waiting for $1 million that they wanted to be paid.
translation.ko: 지급 약속을 받았던 백만 달러를 요구했어요

translation.en: [Luca] There was a huge workforce of people that had been working under the sun
for, you know, a month, a month-and-a-half without being paid...
translation.ko: 한 달 또는 한 달 반 동안 한 푼도 받지 못하고요

translation.en: that as soon as realized that, you know,
all of this was collapsing,
started, rightfully so, demanding their payment,
translation.ko: 정당하게 자신의 몫을 요구하기 시작한 거죠

translation.en: so there was a sort of a strike.
And we get word that there's an angry mob of locals
translation.ko: 화가 난 동네 사람들이 무리를 지어

translation.en: coming down through the gates.
They're pissed off and they want their money.
translation.ko: 화가 잔뜩 나서 받아야 할 돈을 요구했죠

translation.en: And it's now, like, five of us in the production house
There was about,
I don't know, I want to say 30 people coming down.
And Billy is nowhere to be seen.
There were constant rumors flying around of where Billy was.
He was like Dr. Evil. It was like, "Billy's on a yacht."
translation.ko: 닥터 이블 같았죠, 누구는 빌리가 요트에 있다고 하고

translation.en: "Billy's been at the Grand Isle the whole time."
translation.ko: 빌리가 그랜드 아일에 계속 있다는 사람도 있고

translation.en: "Billy's in Miami." "Billy's in jail."
Like, everyone was kind of like guessing where Billy was.
translation.ko: 모두 어디에 있는지 추측만 할 뿐이었어요

translation.en: I didn't even know where Billy went.
I went to the house and it was, like, literally cleaned out,
and I was like, "Yo, where's Billy?"
[Martin] After the locals realized they weren't going to get paid,
translation.ko: 동네 사람들이 돈을 못 받게 될 거란 걸 깨닫자

translation.en: some of them started putting hits out on people,
either to take them hostage and then get ransom
or just to hurt and injure.
The management team looked left and right
and suddenly it was sort of... The "save yourself" mode kicked in.
And I literally traded clothes with one of the employees that had been working with me
translation.ko: 같이 일했던 직원 중 한 명과 옷을 바꿔 입고

translation.en: and I hid behind a urinal.
Someone pulled up in an old car,
I jumped into the back and lay down on the back seat
so I could at least get out of the village.
Because I couldn't play Mother Teresa.
I couldn't fix this problem.
But I needed to go somewhere and find safety.
When they realized this thing came to an abrupt stop,
translation.ko: 모든 게 갑자기 멈췄다는 걸 깨닫자

translation.en: they all leave those rent-a-cars running
with the keys in the ignition.
I talked to one guy who said the door couldn't get open,
translation.ko: 어떤 사람이 차 문이 열리지 않는다고 하자

translation.en: so a lady kicked the door and ran to the airplane.
translation.ko: 여자가 문을 발로 차고 비행기로 도망갔어요

translation.en: So they knew that trouble was ahead.
translation.ko: 문제가 있을 줄 미리 알았던 거죠

translation.en: People started to come to me for, like, money. Like...
translation.ko: 사람들이 돈을 달라고 나한테 오기 시작했어요

translation.en: "You owe us.
Where's the money?"
"I don't know, but they're gone. I don't know what to do."
translation.ko: '나도 몰라요, 그 사람들 가버렸잖아요' '어떻게 할지 모르겠어요'

translation.en: I called Billy, I was talking to Billy. Billy said, "Don't worry, I'll handle it."
translation.ko: 빌리에게 전화했더니 걱정하지 말라고 해결하겠다고 했어요

translation.en: Day after day passed. You know, people were pulling up to my house.
translation.ko: 며칠이 지났고 사람들이 우리 집으로 몰려왔어요

translation.en: They were getting mad for this money. Like, literally mad.
translation.ko: 돈 때문에 화가 나 있었죠 머리끝까지요

translation.en: I thought it was going to end up in some blows getting thrown.
I was like, "Fuck this, I'm out."
I packed my shit and I was fucking on the next boat.
translation.ko: 짐을 싸서 다음 배를 타고 떠났어요

translation.en: You know? "I can't handle it no more."
I definitely had a post-traumatic syndrome,
like many of us did, for weeks and weeks
translation.ko: 다른 사람들도 그랬을 거예요 오랫동안 지속됐죠

translation.en: and a lot of it was a guilt feeling of,
"Did I abandon everybody?"
I was the one that would continue to say, "Listen,
translation.ko: 제가 계속 그렇게 말했거든요 '제 말 들어요'

translation.en: I have been working with Billy for four or five years now. Trust him.
This kid is amazing and I think we can pull this off."
translation.ko: 뛰어난 젊은이에요 해낼 수 있을 거라고 믿어요

translation.en: And we didn't, and I felt definitely,
as I was able to reflect when I got home,
that I had probably led a lot of kids on.
translation.ko: 많은 젊은이에게 착각을 심어줬다는 걸 알게 됐어요

translation.en: You know, you just go with somebody's... It's that energy, and the belief system,
and you just go and you go and you go.
translation.ko: 계속해서 믿게 돼요 그냥 계속 같이 가게 되죠

translation.en: And then when do you stop? And no,
I never thought it would end like this.
I don't think anybody did. If we did, we wouldn't have done it.
translation.ko: 누구도 몰랐을 거예요 알았다면 이렇게 하지 않았겠죠

translation.en: [Billy] First, I just want to give
translation.ko: 먼저 페스티벌이 이렇게 된 것에 대해

translation.en: a big apology for how the festival turned out.
This is obviously the exact opposite
of what we were all striving for.
I made it back home Monday,
and came to the Fyre office,
and that's when we had the teamwide meeting.
[woman] We have to rebrand the platform.
My orthodontist has read about the festival.
translation.ko: 내 치과 교정의가 페스티벌에 대해서 읽고서는

translation.en: And he asked me what I did on the festival.
[Ja] Right now, yes, we are the fucking laughing stock of everything.
We are the "Scam Fyre."
But that might not be the case after we fucking put our plan in play and start to spin it.
translation.ko: 우리가 계획을 세워서 위기를 극복하면 상황이 달라져요

translation.en: They used Samsung as an example of how, you know, "This is just some bad PR."
translation.ko: 삼성을 예로 들었어요 '이건 그냥 홍보가 잘못된 거다'

translation.en: "Samsung's out here blowing people's faces off with cell phones,
but they're still selling cell phones."
They were kind of trying to make it seem like we would overcome this.
translation.ko: 우리가 극복할 수 있을 것처럼 얘기하고 있었어요

translation.en: [Ja] We can't dwell on how we fucked up.
translation.ko: 실패했다는 생각만 하고 있을 순 없어요

translation.en: We can't dwell on what made it go wrong.
translation.ko: 잘못된 점만을 생각하고 있을 순 없다고요

translation.en: We gotta dwell on how we make it better in the future.
translation.ko: 미래에 어떻게 더 잘할 건가에 집중해야 해요

translation.en: The vast majority of us on this phone call were not involved with the festival,
translation.ko: 이 회의에 참석 중인 대다수는 페스티벌에 관여하지 않았어요

translation.en: and then-- Or actively told not to be involved.
So it was...
painful to be honest. We put, you know,
a big, very talented team,
put a ton of hours into that software.
The reality is that I just believed in the core app that we're building so much,
that I was blind to a lot of what was going on internally
with what we were doing.
I mean, it was something that we worked on for an entire year.
translation.ko: 일 년 동안 그렇게 애를 썼지만

translation.en: And because of the festival, we lost everything within seconds.
translation.ko: 페스티벌 때문에 순식간에 모든 것을 잃었어요

translation.en: Is there any way that the product can be built
translation.ko: 한 발짝 물러서 있으면서 제품을 구축할

translation.en: -while we take a step back? -[woman] No. Absolutely not.
He was saying, "We are a family, it's time for us to band together."
translation.ko: '우리는 한 가족이야 함께 뭉쳐야 할 시간이야'

translation.en: And I was feeling like that was so manipulative.
We're not a family, you won't even tell me anything!
You've completely violated all the trust that we had
translation.ko: 우리가 제품, 회사, 당신한테 가지고 있는

translation.en: in the product, in the company, in the brand and in you
and public reception is a separate and almost unrelated problem.
translation.ko: 외부의 평판은 이것과는 별개의 관련 없는 문제라고 봐야 해요

translation.en: [Ja] Come on, guys!
There's a lot of smart people on this fucking phone call, man.
translation.ko: 이 회의에 이렇게 많은 똑똑한 사람들이 참석 중인데

translation.en: Let's think of how to dig ourselves out of this shit, man.
We didn't kill anybody, nobody got hurt.

According to the FBI, 15 people gave him
translation.ko: FBI에 따르면 15명이 티켓 값으로 십만 달러 이상을 주었다고 해요

translation.en: over $100,000 for those tickets.
translation.ko: 티켓 값으로 십만 달러 이상을 주었다고 해요

translation.en: Josh, Frank is gonna call off the list.
translation.ko: 조시, 프랭크가 목록에 있는 사람들에게 전화할 거야

translation.en: If they don't pick up, you send them an email.
I'll write a script for you right now, okay?
What are you recording?
It's hard for me to say if these guys didn't know what was going on.
translation.ko: 그 상황을 이 사람들이 몰랐다고 말하기는 어려울 것 같아요

translation.en: But I also know that Billy is really good at keeping a level of information...
below and above.
For every call, call twice in a row if they don't pick up.
translation.ko: 전화 걸 때 받지 않으면 두 번 연달아 해봐

translation.en: Everybody picks up on the second ring.
translation.ko: 두 번째 걸면 안 받는 사람 없어

translation.en: Let's cut for now. Thanks.
On June 12th, I published an article
translation.ko: 6월 12일에 빌리 맥팔런드와 뉴욕 VIP 액세스 사이의 모든 관계에 대한

translation.en: outlining all the crossover between Billy McFarland
translation.ko: 빌리 맥팔런드와 뉴욕 VIP 액세스 사이의 모든 관계에 대한

translation.en: and New York City VIP Access,
and about six hours later
translation.ko: 약 6시간 후 빌리는 다시 체포됐고 다섯 개의 중범죄로 기소됐어요

translation.en: Billy was rearrested and charged with five felonies.
translation.ko: 약 6시간 후 빌리는 다시 체포됐고 다섯 개의 중범죄로 기소됐어요 "파이어 페스티벌의 창립자 감옥행 사기 행각은 여전"

translation.en: They included fraud, money laundering,
identity theft, and witness intimidation
translation.ko: 신원 도용, 목격자 협박 등의 혐의가 포함됐어요 "다섯 건의 재판 방해"

translation.en: after he warned at least two people not to talk to the FBI
translation.ko: 적어도 두 명의 사람들에게 FBI와 얘기하지 말라고 경고했고

translation.en: and to pretend that they were represented by legal counsel
translation.ko: 법률 고문의 변호를 받는 척 했지만

translation.en: when they were not.
I mean, the idea of him doing this
translation.ko: 보석 중에도 이런 행각을 벌인다는 생각 자체가

translation.en: while he's out on bail is mind-blowing to me.
translation.ko: 보석 중에도 이런 행각을 벌인다는 생각 자체가 너무 놀라워요

translation.en: Because you're already under the biggest microscope,
and then you're gonna go and commit another scam.
Like, I just don't understand why he didn't just stop.
translation.ko: 왜 거기서 멈추지 않는지 이해가 되지 않아요

translation.en: [Interviewer] You said Billy asked you about going, what...
What was he asking you about jail?
Well, unfortunately, I had a misstep in my past,
and, um...
I unfortunately experienced it.
And I was in there for two months.
And, you know, he just flat out asked me. He was like, "What was it like?"
And I was like, "It's 23/1 for the first seven days."
He was like, "What's 23/1?"
"You're in a fucking cell for 23 hours.
And then they let you out for one.
translation.ko: '1시간 동안은 감방 밖으로 나갈 수 있어'

translation.en: You better stretch your legs, walk around,
do whatever you need to do, but you're in there
translation.ko: '하고 싶은 걸 하면 되지 절차가 끝날 때까지'

translation.en: until you're processed. After that, they put you where they need to put you,
translation.ko: '감방에 있어야 해 절차가 끝나면 그때 배치를 받아 진짜 감옥으로 가지

translation.en: until you get sent up north."
translation.ko: 절차가 끝나면 그때 배치를 받아 진짜 감옥으로 가지

translation.en: And I remember the energy off of him. And it was just like...
That shit was so far away from what he knew
translation.ko: 그가 아는 것들이나 그의 인생 경험과

translation.en: and what he experienced in his life,
that the cognitive dissonance just led him to say,
translation.ko: 인지적으로 받아들일 수 없어서 그렇게 말한 것 같아요

translation.en: "I'm not going to jail."
[Marc] I reflected on myself
and I was questioning to what extent was I guilty,
to what extent was I complicit in all of this.
translation.ko: 얼마나 공모자의 역할을 했는지 자문해보곤 해요

translation.en: And I looked back at my posts on social media
translation.ko: 소셜 미디어에 올린 게시물들을 다시 보면

translation.en: and it was like all beautiful beaches and sunsets.
translation.ko: 온통 아름다운 바닷가와 석양으로 가득 차 있어요

translation.en: You know? And...
And I was going through the hardest experience of my life,
translation.ko: 인생에서 가장 힘든 시기를 보내고 있었어요

translation.en: and yet if you had seen it, you'd have been like,
"Wow, what a great life this guy leads.
He's living in the Bahamas, going to beaches all day."
And Fyre shows what happens when you take that to an extreme.
translation.ko: 파이어는 아주 극단적인 예를 보여준 것 같아요

translation.en: I've said this multiple times - the real Fyre Festival happened twice.
translation.ko: 여러 번 했던 얘긴데요 파이어 페스티벌은 두 번 열렸어요

translation.en: It was the shoots.
What the commercial was was what everybody wanted.
translation.ko: 그 광고가 바로 모든 사람들이 원하던 거였죠

translation.en: The shoots were parties.
It just happened to happen for 60 people versus 6,000.
[J.R.] It was epic.
It was nothing I never saw before in my whole entire life. Like...
I'm from the Bahamas, man. We're used to small island stuff.
translation.ko: 전 바하마 사람이에요 작은 섬에 사는 데 익숙해요

translation.en: That was like... That put me up on a new level, a higher level.
translation.ko: 그 파티는 다른 세계로 절 안내했어요, 더 높은 세계요

translation.en: [Jillionaire] We're living in this influencers society, you know?
translation.ko: 우리 모두 인플루언서 사회에 살고 있지 않나요?

translation.en: Everybody wants to have this online clout,
translation.ko: 모두 온라인상으로 영향력 있는 사람들을 좋아해요

translation.en: people want to have access
and they want exclusivity.
Fyre was basically, like, Instagram coming to life.
translation.ko: 파이어는 인스타그램이 현실화된 거라고 보면 돼요

translation.en: It actually dovetails really interestingly with just random news stories that have come out since.
translation.ko: 최근에 읽은 어떤 뉴스와 이 이야기가 잘 들어맞는데요

translation.en: I was reading about a company in Russia
that now will sell people like three hours to do a photo shoot
translation.ko: 이 회사는 사람들에게 전용 비행기에서 3시간 동안 촬영할 수 있는 티켓을 팔아요

translation.en: on a private jet that's just parked on the tarmac.
They never actually leave,
but they get to take the picture looking out the window,
and pretending that they're living this lifestyle.
translation.ko: 이런 라이프스타일을 사는 것처럼 보이게 해주죠

translation.en: And, like, they're successful. People are using it.
translation.ko: 사업이 매우 잘된다고 하더군요 사람들이 실제로 이용해요

translation.en: Billy seemed really invested in that whole lifestyle.
translation.ko: 빌리는 이런 라이프스타일에 정말로 투자했던 것 같아요

translation.en: Yo, I wanna say happy birthday to my brother,
translation.ko: 친구이자 파트너인 빌리에게 생일 축하하고 싶어요

translation.en: my partner Billy in the building. Happy birthday, Billy.
I think it was important to him not just to be on a plane with a model,
translation.ko: 빌리는 모델과 비행기를 타는 정도가 아니라

translation.en: but to feel like that was his life.
translation.ko: 그게 자신의 진짜 삶인 듯 그 세계에 속해 있는 듯

translation.en: That he belonged there. And not because he owns Fyre,
translation.ko: 느끼는 게 중요했나 봐요 파이어를 소유해서가 아니라

translation.en: but because that's who he was.
He was completely out of his depth, and he's,
unfortunately for himself, a compulsive liar.
translation.ko: 안타깝게도 거짓말을 하지 않고는 못 배기는 사람이었고요

translation.en: And someone that at the end, you know, should be held accountable.
translation.ko: 결국에는 모든 책임을 그가 져야 하죠

translation.en: [MDavid] He has a massive debt,
not just to the people who invested or to the concert-goers.
I think he has a larger debt to the employees that were reporting and working with him.
translation.ko: 같이 일한 직원들에게 더 큰 빚을 졌어요

translation.en: The only way, in my opinion, a guy like this learns his lesson
translation.ko: 제 생각에 이런 사람이 교훈을 얻으려면

translation.en: is actually going to jail.
[Calvin] I don't think that we've heard the last of Billy McFarland.
I mean, if there's anything that guy is good at,
it's separating consumers from their cash.
And if there's anything that this country
translation.ko: 이 나라가 현금보다 더 귀하게 여기는 게 있는지는

translation.en: celebrates more than that, I don't know.
[Marc] Billy has a presence where, you know, there's something behind the smile.
translation.ko: 빌리 미소 뒤에는 사람을 끄는 무언가가 있어요

translation.en: I wouldn't be surprised if ten years down the line,
we're hearing about Billy McFarland
starting some kind of other venture that's...
you know, imaginative and, uh,
and gets some serious momentum
and, you know, this all happens in some form again.
translation.ko: 이런 일이 어떤 형태로 다시 일어날 수 있어요

translation.en: It's Billy!
What's up, Billy?
I'm in front of the cameraman. I'm talking--
I'm good.
Yeah. I'm putting in some good words.
You want me to say anything on the camera for you?
All right.
All right. Action!
